note.p: Architect and geologist. Draughtsman for the London and North Western railway company, 1853–60. Set up in private practice as an architect and civil engineer in 1860; architect to the Liverpool School Board, 1870–1902. Joined the Liverpool Geological Society in 1870. Fellow of the Geological Society of London, 1872; awarded its Murchison medal, 1896. Worked on local glacial and post-glacial deposits; published nearly 200 scientific papers, and The origin of the mountain ranges (1886).
